General course objectives:
General course objectives
The course encompasses the fundamental approaches to operations and supply chain management (O&SCM) based on a sustainability agenda encompassed in the UN sustainability goals. The course gives a broad overview of the fundamental concerns of O&SCM, unfolding the complexity of designing and managing complex operations within global supply chains.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Appraise reasons for sustainable operations and supply chain management (O&SCM), including the connection to the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
Identify and compare design principles for sustainable product design
Define key concepts for sustainable production and Operations Management (OM)
Apply principles of lean management in the context of sustainability
Debate how services and servitization enable sustainability in manufacturing contexts
Describe core concepts of supply chain dynamics in the context of sustainability
Evaluate different approaches to sustainable procurement and supplier management
Assess core concepts of sustainable logistics management
Debate challenges and benefits of reverse supply chains in practice
Identify, select, assess, apply, and criticise relevant literature and data for a scientific issue and present a coherent argument
Content:
The course covers different aspects of operations and supply chain management (O&SCM) in light of sustainability goals. The course consists of the following three parts (not equal):
1. Product design for sustainability
2. Sustainable production and operations management
3. Sustainable supply chain management

Moreover, the course will train and apply research methodology practices and tools relevant to MSc engineering students.
Course literature:
The primary literature of the course will be M. Kreye: "Sustainable Operations & Supply Chain Management", Routledge, Taylor and Francis Group.

Additional reading material, such as excerpts from books/textbooks or academic research papers, will be provided during the course.
